p.s: The novel The Great Gatsby, written by F. Scott Fitzgerald published in 1925 is an americanAmerican classic and is about the rise and fall of Jay Gatsby.
The given excerpt deals with Gatsby and Daisy meeting again after a long time without seeing.
The excerpt starts with Daisy and Nick entering his house, where she asks him why she had to come alone.
When Nick and Daisy arrive in the living room, Gatsby is gone, which makes Nick chuckle.
Since Daisy doesn't know about Gatsby and that he is also there.
So she wonders why Nick was laughing.
Gatsby then enters the room from the front door.
Daisy is really surprised to see him, but also excited.
Gatsby is excited too, so excited that he breaks Nick's clock.
Then after some awkward silence between those three Nick gets up to ask him for a quick talk.
Gatsby, who is freaking out, tells Nick that it was a mistake to invite Daisy over.
And then blames him for not treating Daisy right.
After that Nick leaves his own house troughthrough the backdoor.
From there he starts to stare at Gatsby's house.
After half an hour of looking at it, Nick goes back to his house.
Gatsby and Daisy are now sitting there talking.
As Nick enters, Gatsby gets up from the couch and suggest Nick and Daisy should come visit his house, to which Nick asks him, if he really wants him to come.
